nested_items.name: knowledgeBaseSummaries
nested_items.description: Information about the knowledge bases.

nested_items.name: knowledgeBaseId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the knowledge base.

nested_items.name: knowledgeBaseArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the knowledge base.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the knowledge base.

nested_items.name: knowledgeBaseType
nested_items.description: The type of knowledge base.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The status of the knowledge base summary.

nested_items.name: sourceConfiguration
nested_items.description: Configuration information about the external data source.

nested_items.name: appIntegrations
nested_items.description: Configuration information for Amazon AppIntegrations to automatically ingest content.

nested_items.name: appIntegrationArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AppIntegrations DataIntegration to use for ingesting content.

For Salesforce, your AppIntegrations DataIntegration must have an ObjectConfiguration if objectFields is not provided, including at least Id, ArticleNumber, VersionNumber, Title, PublishStatus, and IsDeleted as source fields.

For ServiceNow, your AppIntegrations DataIntegration must have an ObjectConfiguration if objectFields is not provided, including at least number, short_description, sys_mod_count, workflow_state, and active as source fields.
For Zendesk, your AppIntegrations DataIntegration must have an ObjectConfiguration if objectFields is not provided, including at least id, title, updated_at, and draft as source fields.
For SharePoint, your AppIntegrations DataIntegration must have a FileConfiguration, including only file extensions that are among docx, pdf, html, htm, and txt.

For Amazon S3, the ObjectConfiguration and FileConfiguration of your AppIntegrations DataIntegration must be null. The SourceURI of your DataIntegration must use the following format: s3://your_s3_bucket_name.

nested_items.name: objectFields
nested_items.description: The fields from the source that are made available to your agents in Amazon Q in Connect. Optional if ObjectConfiguration is included in the provided DataIntegration.
For Salesforce, you must include at least Id, ArticleNumber, VersionNumber, Title, PublishStatus, and IsDeleted.
For ServiceNow, you must include at least number, short_description, sys_mod_count, workflow_state, and active.
For Zendesk, you must include at least id, title, updated_at, and draft.

nested_items.name: managedSourceConfiguration
nested_items.description: Source configuration for managed resources.

nested_items.name: webCrawlerConfiguration
nested_items.description: Configuration data for web crawler data source.

nested_items.name: urlConfiguration
nested_items.description: The configuration of the URL/URLs for the web content that you want to crawl. You should be authorized to crawl the URLs.

nested_items.name: seedUrls
nested_items.description: List of URLs for crawling.

nested_items.name: url
nested_items.description: URL for crawling.

nested_items.name: crawlerLimits
nested_items.description: The configuration of crawl limits for the web URLs.

nested_items.name: rateLimit
nested_items.description: Rate of web URLs retrieved per minute.

nested_items.name: inclusionFilters
nested_items.description: A list of one or more inclusion regular expression patterns to include certain URLs. If you specify an inclusion and exclusion filter/pattern and both match a URL, the exclusion filter takes precedence and the web content of the URL isn't crawled.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: exclusionFilters
nested_items.description: A list of one or more exclusion regular expression patterns to exclude certain URLs. If you specify an inclusion and exclusion filter/pattern and both match a URL, the exclusion filter takes precedence and the web content of the URL isn't crawled.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: scope
nested_items.description: The scope of what is crawled for your URLs. You can choose to crawl only web pages that belong to the same host or primary domain. For example, only web pages that contain the seed URL https://docs.aws.amazon.com/bedrock/latest/userguide/ and no other domains. You can choose to include sub domains in addition to the host or primary domain. For example, web pages that contain aws.amazon.com can also include sub domain docs.aws.amazon.com.

nested_items.name: vectorIngestionConfiguration
nested_items.description: Contains details about how to ingest the documents in a data source.

nested_items.name: chunkingConfiguration
nested_items.description: Details about how to chunk the documents in the data source. A chunk refers to an excerpt from a data source that is returned when the knowledge base that it belongs to is queried.

nested_items.name: chunkingStrategy
nested_items.description: Knowledge base can split your source data into chunks. A chunk refers to an excerpt from a data source that is returned when the knowledge base that it belongs to is queried. You have the following options for chunking your data. If you opt for NONE, then you may want to pre-process your files by splitting them up such that each file corresponds to a chunk.

nested_items.name: fixedSizeChunkingConfiguration
nested_items.description: Configurations for when you choose fixed-size chunking. If you set the chunkingStrategy as NONE, exclude this field.

nested_items.name: maxTokens
nested_items.description: The maximum number of tokens to include in a chunk.

nested_items.name: overlapPercentage
nested_items.description: The percentage of overlap between adjacent chunks of a data source.

nested_items.name: hierarchicalChunkingConfiguration
nested_items.description: Settings for hierarchical document chunking for a data source. Hierarchical chunking splits documents into layers of chunks where the first layer contains large chunks, and the second layer contains smaller chunks derived from the first layer.

nested_items.name: levelConfigurations
nested_items.description: Token settings for each layer.

nested_items.name: maxTokens
nested_items.description: The maximum number of tokens that a chunk can contain in this layer.

nested_items.name: overlapTokens
nested_items.description: The number of tokens to repeat across chunks in the same layer.

nested_items.name: semanticChunkingConfiguration
nested_items.description: Settings for semantic document chunking for a data source. Semantic chunking splits a document into smaller documents based on groups of similar content derived from the text with natural language processing.

nested_items.name: maxTokens
nested_items.description: The maximum number of tokens that a chunk can contain.

nested_items.name: bufferSize
nested_items.description: The buffer size.

nested_items.name: breakpointPercentileThreshold
nested_items.description: The dissimilarity threshold for splitting chunks.

nested_items.name: parsingConfiguration
nested_items.description: A custom parser for data source documents.

nested_items.name: parsingStrategy
nested_items.description: The parsing strategy for the data source.

nested_items.name: bedrockFoundationModelConfiguration
nested_items.description: Settings for a foundation model used to parse documents for a data source.

nested_items.name: modelArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the foundation model.

nested_items.name: parsingPrompt
nested_items.description: Instructions for interpreting the contents of a document.

nested_items.name: parsingPromptText
nested_items.description: Instructions for interpreting the contents of a document.

nested_items.name: renderingConfiguration
nested_items.description: Information about how to render the content.

nested_items.name: templateUri
nested_items.description: A URI template containing exactly one variable in ${variableName} ``format. This can only be set for ``EXTERNAL knowledge bases. For Salesforce, ServiceNow, and Zendesk, the variable must be one of the following:
Salesforce: Id, ArticleNumber, VersionNumber, Title, PublishStatus, or IsDeleted.
ServiceNow: number, short_description, sys_mod_count, workflow_state, or active.
Zendesk: id, title, updated_at, or draft.

nested_items.name: serverSideEncryptionConfiguration
nested_items.description: The configuration information for the customer managed key used for encryption.

nested_items.name: kmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The customer managed key used for encryption. For more information about setting up a customer managed key for Amazon Q in Connect, see Enable Amazon Q in Connect for your instance. For information about valid ID values, see Key identifiers (KeyId).

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: The description of the knowledge base.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: nextToken
nested_items.description: If there are additional results, this is the token for the next set of results.
